subject: Sleep
title: Alcohol Helps You Sleep
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Alcohol Helps You Sleep.

hook.text: A nightcap helps you drift off faster. That part is true. Everything that happens after is a disaster.

buildup.text: Alcohol is a sedative that speeds sleep onset, which is why people believe it's a sleep aid.

discovery.text: Alcohol suppresses REM sleep, fragments sleep architecture, and causes early morning awakenings as it metabolizes.

twist.text: You fall asleep faster but the sleep you get is biologically inferior. It's sedation, not restorative sleep.

climax.text: Even moderate drinking, two drinks four hours before bed, reduces sleep quality by nearly 40 percent.

punchline.text: Alcohol doesn't help you sleep. It helps you pass out. Those are different things.

quiz.question: How does alcohol affect sleep quality?
options: It speeds onset but suppresses REM and fragments sleep architecture
It has no effect on sleep
